abstract: In testimony prepared for a Senate Banking Committee hearing on Wednesday, Jamie Dimon sounded a note of contrition, but also emphasized the strength of the bank.
snippet: In testimony prepared for a Senate Banking Committee hearing on Wednesday, Jamie Dimon sounded a note of contrition, but also emphasized the strength of the bank.
lead_paragraph: When JPMorgan’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, appears Wednesday on Capitol Hill, he plans to play down the risky trading activities that have already prompted at least $3 billion in losses.

headline.main: JPMorgan Chief Is Expected to Play Down Trade Risks at Hearing
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Chief Expected to Play Down Trade Risks

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chief Is Expected to Play Down Trade Risks at Hearing  |  When JPMorgan’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, appears Wednesday on Capitol Hill, he plans to play down the risky trading activities that have already prompted at least $3 billion in losses.

abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, testified on Wednesday before the Senate Banking Committee about a failed derivatives trade that could cost the bank as much as $5 billion in losses.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, testified on Wednesday before the Senate Banking Committee about a failed derivatives trade that could cost the bank as much as $5 billion in losses.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chairman and chief executive, testified before the Senate Banking Committee about the multibillion-dollar trading losses incurred at his firm’s chief investment office.

headline.main: Live Blog: Senate Banking Hearing on JPMorgan

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Ben Protess

abstract: The Congressional testimony of JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, indicates that the bank’s risk models are central to understanding the circumstances that led to its multibillion-dollar trading loss.
snippet: The Congressional testimony of JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, indicates that the bank’s risk models are central to understanding the circumstances that led to its multibillion-dollar trading loss.

abstract: June 13, 2012 - Jamie Dimon's fall from being 'America's Banker.'
snippet: June 13, 2012 - Jamie Dimon's fall from being 'America's Banker.'
lead_paragraph: June 13, 2012 - Jamie Dimon's fall from being 'America's Banker.'

abstract: In testimony before the Senate Banking Committee, Jamie Dimon assured lawmakers that the bank’s board was investigating the trading losses. Once the investigation is complete, he said, the bank will decide whose paychecks to pursue.
snippet: In testimony before the Senate Banking Committee, Jamie Dimon assured lawmakers that the bank’s board was investigating the trading losses. Once the investigation is complete, he said, the bank will decide whose paychecks to pursue.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — JPMorgan Chase is “likely” to try to recover compensation from executives responsible for a recent multibillion-dollar trading blowup, according to Jamie Dimon, the bank’s chief executive.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Chief Says Clawback Efforts Are ‘Likely’
